name: ISTITUTO SUPERIORE DI SANITA'
goal: The Istituto Superiore di Sanit√† (ISS) is the Italian National Institute of Public Health, carrying out scientific-technical Research for the Italian National Health System, providing control and advice in Public Health. Its role within the Italian Health System is to promote Public Health through scientific Research, surveys, and interventions in different fields of Health sciencies which include communicable and non-communicable diseases, environment, food and drugs.
interests: Climate Action, Culture, Education and training, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: ISS is mainly interested in the fields: H2020, Public Health Programme, EURATOM, EMA policy, ECDC surveillance system, EFSA, ECHA.
